comment: This app is a great idea - a remote to ring your phone to help you find it. Alerts on the wear device when your phone is disconnected (because you left it on a table somewhere) and also on wear when your phone battery is low.  Great features in a simple to use app that's "always on' - no hassle.
title: Excelent realization of what Wear can do

author: Jeff Thornton
comment: Maybe you could use a different notification for the phone finder... I have my alarm sound down low so I don't blow my eardrums out in the morning, so this won't be of much use. Wear Aware, you could specify which sound you wanted to use and didn't use the alarm system. Also, maybe a BUNCH of vibration... Like 3-4 buzzes minimum... The G Watch has fairly light vibration (as do most AW from what I've heard) and it wouldn't be hard to miss this. Phone Status doesn't work on my G Watch.. Feature coming soon. All together a great app though!
title: Pretty good!

author: Drew Gramlich
comment: Saw a review saying it doesn't work for the moto360. It does. I only really see a benefit in the find my phone feature since android wear does most everything else, but hey, it works and it does exactly what it says. So many watch apps on google play are being bashed by people who have something not synced correctly. Resync your apps if you have issues. Worse case, reset your wear and pair your device again.
title: Just tested it on moto360. Worked.

author: Danny FitzGerald
comment: Really like the idea of the app. The lost phone ringing option is good but I really wanted to use the phone status feature... it does not work at all on a Sony Smart watch 3 and Galaxy S5. Hope this is fixed in a future update.
title: Nice idea, sadly some functions not working

author: Daniel Hickman
comment: The battery notification should only occur when the battery becomes low and is connected. Instead it sends it to the queue and shows up next time it's connected. All the text is jumbled on the newest version of AW on the Moto 360
title: Claimed Low Battery and Looks Poor

author: Mark Gardham
comment: ....Phone status feature not available yet.  So Find My Phone feature is the only working thing.  As I have that as standard on my LG Nexus 5X I won't be using this app.  For now, if it comes up later then I may try it again.
title: Nice idea but......

author: Marc Lee
comment: Some similar apps launch really loud and intrusive alarms when the phone is out of range. This is more subtle and uses a card notification more in tune with the standard Android Wear implementation. I like it. Just one suggestion... It would be good if the notification could be suppressed when the watch goes into airplane mode as the reason for the disconnection is obvious.
title: Neat implementation.

author: Paul Lowden
comment: Have a moto 360. The battery indicator doesn't work. If you disconnect Bluetooth and use WiFi instead, it constantly hounds you with disconnect messages. I swiped once already, why does it keep asking me? Basically, there's better apps for this.
title: Terrible really...

author: John Le
comment: When opened on a Note 4, app sits at a "device connected" screen and does nothing else. Cannot pull up any options through watch either. Using an LG G Watch R paired to a Samsung Note 4.
title: Doesn't not work

author: Geoff
comment: Phone status option says feature is not available and find my phone option does nothing on phone when pressed. Great idea. Hope it gets updated for Moto 360, the best wearable out!
title: Non functional on Moto 360

author: Johan Agurén
comment: It does make phone ring but occasionally asks if I've forgotten my phone (lost contact) although it's in my pocket or hand.
title: Works but could use some work.

author: Paul King
comment: A great idea, but it keeps going off as I move around the house, and I don't always have phone in pocket. Just needs to be slightly less sensitive.
title: Bit too sensitive

author: Michael Bent
comment: The lost phone function is useless. If your phone is on silent it won't ring. It won't vibrate. It won't do anything. It won't even light up. Kind of pointless.
title: Fix this now...

author: Steve Balayewich
comment: Would be nice to have an alarm to notify me when I get to far from phone. I have a bad habit of leaving it.  Something audible would be better than the message on the watch face.
title: Figured some of it out.

author: Nestor Custodio
comment: No need to panic anymore when your phone isn't on hand. The "ring my phone" function is THE easiest way to immediately track down a misplaced phone.
title: This thing is a life-saver!

author: B. White
comment: Didn't work on my ZenWatch 2 at all. Even though the app said connected to my phone, everytime I clicked 'phone status' it just said 'sorry, this feature is not available yet'. Uninstalled.
Looks great, and reliably alerts when walking away, but that alert as well as the find phone feature don't have a persistent alert, just vibrates once. Can't believe that that's the desired action.
title: Nice UI, but unclear

author: Nick Foti
comment: Should be noted in the app description that phone status button is disabled on moto 360. Find phone and other features work great. Looking forward to the other functionality becoming available.
title: Phone status doesn't work

author: Jennifer McGaffey
comment: Almost very useful app I like the Phone Disconnected alert, although it goes off more often when my phone is plugged in one room and I'm in another than when I've actually forgotten my phone. I really _don't_ like the Phone Battery Low alert, because it doesn't go away when the phone has been charged. So nearly every morning I have to swipe away a Battery Low alert from the night before - boring. If there were options in the app for which alerts I wanted to see, I'd like it a lot better (or if it would self-dismiss the battery alert when the phone reported charging, that would be excellent). I've never needed the Find My Phone function that's the only other thing it can do, so can't comment.

author: Parker Roy
comment: But there are still a few things. Support for more devices, maybe a few more option. Thanks for the apps!
title: Conceptually, it's there.

author: Don S
comment: Installed on my Motorola Droid phone and Huawei Watch. Location option works, but the ability to monitor phone status says "Not yet available". Is that expected for the Huawei Watch? If so, do you have an outlook for when you will be supporting Huawei. I am currently running Android Wear 6.0.

author: Jussi Honkonen
comment: Does what it promises with no problems. SGS 4 Active + lg watch urbane. Would maybe be nice for some to be able to configure the different features on/off, but this is no problem for me since I want all of them on. Mute phone feature would be nice too.

author: Bram Ruttens
comment: I like all the functions that are present and will come, but it would come in handy if you can add vibration to the ringing mode. Maybe an idea :)
title: Great app already!

author: Csabi Buruzs
comment: Does not really work as advertised, it tells me that I have no connection only if my watch is active (screen on) and phone status feature from the watch doesn't work. I am using a ZenFone2 with a Huawei Watch.

author: Bill Jordan
comment: I just installed (paired LG G3 and G Watch).  The phone app says connected and alerts when I move out of range (nice).  I restarted my watch and also re-synced wearable apps for good measure, but still do not see how to get to the "WearBuddy Phone Status" screen (first image in your gallery).  I assume this is where one goes to get to the Start/Stop ringing screens to locate the phone.  I should be able to call this up from the watch alone.  I hope the developer will contact me with instructions so I will be able to use these features.  I will up my rating when I am able to use the application features as described.  [UPDATE] Useful reply from developer explained how to launch.  Phone status feature not implemented but phone locator is.  I'm upping my review 1-star.  Will probably go 1 more when all features (useful phone info, more phone/wear partner features) are implemented making it a more mature product.

reply.author: Luigi Notaro
reply.content: Hi Bill, you need to go to the "Start..." menu of your smartwatch to get a list of installed apps; then from there, you can choose Wear Buddy. I used the standard pattern for Android Wear Apps :)

title: Need instructions

comment: Find my phone works and even rings however, nothing else... this app has a lot of potential and I would personally say hold off till the other features are fully developed
title: Moto360 w/ note 4

author: Don Menzies
comment: Didn't work well on my SW3. Gave no phone status info. Only made my phone ring to locate. Uninstalled.
title: Only one card displayed

author: Tae H. Kim
comment: Really like this app for my 360.  Works well.  Also great bc no need to download a separate app to alert you when you leave your phone behind, Wear Buddy has that function included.
title: Great App, Must Have!

comment: Find my phone is a duplicate function of wear's built-in, but phone status doesn't work on Moto 360. Useless right now.
title: No phone status on moto360

author: George Michas
comment: What's the point of having a phone status icon that does nothing but tell you it's unimplemented. At least don't make it the default when you launch the app.
title: What's the point?

author: cody offenbacher
comment: Killed my watches battery, uninstalled it and got my good battery life back. Cool idea, but the app is way too buggy.
title: Killed battery

author: João Tiago Fonseca
comment: Feature not available? why do you let OnePlus One users install if the main purpose of this app doesn't work? Any plans on making this available soon?

author: Brian Calderon
comment: Is the phone status ever coming? I'd love to get notifications of my phone being fully charged at 100% and the ability to see the battery and other information when opening the phone status option in the wear app.
title: Phone Status?

author: Alex Nettles
comment: Needs in interface for your phone, as when I press to find my phone, it just sounds one notification beep
title: Almost there

author: Russell Clark
comment: The "Find my phone" feature works, but the "Phone Status" feature doesn't.  It just says "Sorry, this feature is not available yet."  I'm using the Lg G Watch R and with my LG G3.
title: Looks nice but doesn't work

author: kirk lewis
comment: Find my phone settings turn the notification ring tone down to the lowest setting making it pointless
title: Find my phone

author: Trent Sanden
comment: The only feature that works with my moto 360 is make my phone ring works, everything else does not work with my watch.  The only reason I keep this app so I can find my phone from my watch.
title: Not bad

author: Antony Wang
comment: Card has layout problem. Percentage number overlaps with other words
title: Issue on moto 360

author: bill black
comment: Needed something to tell me when I walk away from the phone :-)
title: Working on Moto 360

author: Fredrik Sandebert
comment: Status is not implemented, and ringing doesn't ring. This is junk.
title: Does nothing
